result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Gullo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to 15CM1989, 15CM1995, 15CF2479 (count 1), 15CF2537 (counts 1 and 3), 17CM1225 and 18CM919; concurrent with 15CF2515 (count 3), 15CF2479 (count 3) and 15CF2537 (count 2).

superMiscConds.notes: DOC collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Gullo

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
Defendant Completed Substance Abuse Program
Gerber

records.addlTxt: 02:47 PM Defendant Anthony J. Gullo in court in custody with attorney Barbara Lynn Gerber.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court enters guilty adjudication on count 1.  PSI WAIVED.  Court orders on count 1:  3 years prison, 5 years extended supervision, consecutive to 15CM1989, 15CM1995, 15CF2479 (count 1), 15CF2537 (counts 1 and 3), 17CM1225 and 18CM919; concurrent with 15CF2515 (count 3), 15CF2479 (count 3) and 15CF2537 (count 2); DOC collect $528 costs; complete any assessments and comply with all treatment deemed necessary; maintain absolute sobriety; may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol; eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs; no sentence credit.  Felon warnings advised.
State's Motion to Revoke Hold Open Agreement
Motion hearing on December 12, 2019 at 02:30 pm.
